iris.imageToBitcode
Class BitcodeGenerator

java.lang.Object
  iris.imageToBitcode.BitcodeGenerator

public class BitcodeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

A class that uses Gabor filters to generate a bitcode from an image of an iris The basic idea is to create different Gabor wavelets, defined by the constants a,b,w,x0 and y0 and filter the unwrapped iris with those wavelets. The total number of bits returned is the total number of different combinations of those constants * 2 (since a Gabor wavelet has real and complex parts).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Arnar B. Jonsson, Mark Howe, Edmund Noon

Parameters:
_wPar - Gabor parameter 1
_abPar - Gabor parameter 2
_x0Par - Gabor parameter 3
_y0Par - Gabor parameter 4
_unwrWidth - width of unwrapped image
_unwrHeight - height of image

public void initialiseParams(GaborParameters _wPar,
                             GaborParameters _abPar,
                             GaborParameters _x0Par,
                             GaborParameters _y0Par,
                             int _unwrWidth,
                             int _unwrHeight,
                             int _bitsPerBox)
Parameters:

_abPar - Gabor parameter 2
_x0Par - Gabor parameter 3
_y0Par - Gabor parameter 4
_unwrWidth - width of unwrapped image
_unwrHeight - height of image
_bitsPerBox - 1 for one and 2 for two (1 ignores the real part)

eyeImage - image of eye to be converted
eye - data for cetre of pulil and iris

Bitcode

drawWavelet

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawWavelet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage eyeImage,
                                                int x0,
                                                int y0,
                                                int step)
Only for testing and report purposes, and for visually seeing the Gabor Wavelet

Parameters:
eyeImage -
x0 - is the centre of the wavelet box
y0 - is the centre fo the wavelet box
step - which of the boxes to draw
Returns:
buffered image with the gaussian, cos term sine term, and some biassed cos terms
